summary: An internal FBI email chain from July 2-3, 2019, discussing operational planning following the indictment of Jeffrey Epstein in the Southern District of New York. The email outlines the need for agents to be on standby to arrest Epstein upon his return to the U.S., execute a search warrant at his NYC residence, interview co-conspirators, and deploy agents to Florida to serve subpoenas and interview individuals.

persons.name: Epstein
persons.context: The subject of the indictment and arrest warrant; believed to be in France at the time of the email.

events.title: Epstein Indicted in SDNY
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was indicted in the Southern District of New York, and a warrant for his arrest was sworn out.

events.title: FBI Operational Planning
events.description: FBI squad C-20 (VCAC/Human Trafficking) begins planning to arrest Epstein upon his return to the U.S., execute a search warrant at his NYC residence, interview co-conspirators, and deploy agents to Florida to serve subpoenas and interview 1-3 individuals.

keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein was indicted in the Southern District of New York on July 2, 2019, and an arrest warrant was issued.
At the time of the email, Epstein was believed to be in France, and the FBI planned to arrest him immediately upon his return to the U.S.
The FBI planned to execute a search warrant at Epstein's residence in New York City and interview co-conspirators.
The FBI also planned to deploy two agents to Florida to serve subpoenas and attempt to interview 1-3 individuals.
The email indicates the investigation involved FBI Squad C-20 (VCAC/Human Trafficking) from the New York office, requiring the entire squad and additional assistance.
